greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime with exactly n consecutive ones in the longest run of ones in its binary expansion.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3310
mathematica: a = Table[0, {30}]; NextPrim[n_] := Block[{k = n + 1}, While[ ! PrimeQ[k], k++ ]; k]; p = 2; Do[ m = Length[ Union[ DeleteCases[ Split[ IntegerDigits[p, 2]], 0, 2]][[ -1]]]; If[ a[[m]] == 0, a[[m]] = p]; p = NextPrim[p], {n, 1, 117000000}]
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 03 2003
